intro: Iphiona anthemidifolia, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to white. The plant typically has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as dunes or disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environments, contributing to its ecological significance in its native range.
